Posts.Content: pagodaswan wrote: Ello everyone I apologise in advance for rambling, this has got be somewhat flustered and nervous, so please forgive me for being longwinded...  Back in the early 1990's I had bloody discharge from my left breast, I saw my then GP and was referred to the local hospital and had ducts removed.  About 3 years later, same thing, same breast and I had more ducts removed plus half the nipple removed. Then just as I thought I had seen the back of an operating theater, I had to have a hysterectomy in 1996 due to endometriosis...they left the ovaries behind (not sure why since they are the main culprits for endometriosis). In 1999 I again had bloody discharge from a breast, this time my right one.  Went through the GP/surgeon thing and had ducts removed.  In 2002 I got the problem again in the right breast...with thickening of the areola, slight enlargement of the right breast and a tingly feeling...again, ducts removed plus 2 lymph nodes removed.  All 4 microdectomies (sp) done due to "probable" papilloma's...only once having had a mammogram. Roll forward to June 2010 and I had the ovaries removed following endometriosis gluing down the bowel & bladder. And now we are back at square one....about 2 months ago, right breast started tingling, the nipple burrowed its way inward and daily moderate bloody discharge.  The areola has thickened up again, the tingling feeling is as if the now completely retracted nipple is being pulled further inward, I had a rash like appearance around the nipple area...basically my nipple and areola have become one thickened area with a very weird shaping...ie...no longer the neat round shape, but a blotchy sort of shape. Last week I went to my GP and tomorrow I see the local breast clinic for tests (at this stage I have no clue what tests).  I am 48 years old, female and have 2 deceased aunts on my mothers side affected with breast cancer, unsure about any other family members due to them all passing away when I was a child.  Both parents passed when I was in my 20's. I know it's like asking how long a piece of string is, but does anyone have any advice as to what this might really be...and what I should ask tomorrow, please? Thanks  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 03:00PM - edited Aug 13, 2012 03:01PM by pagodaswan You are so right Celine LOL I have a questionaire to fill in ready for tomorrow's appointment..."please describe your symptoms"...ha!...the space is not big enough for starters...sat here doing a timeline type thing for the last two months, have run out of room (wording is totally not medically recogniseable, but its how it feels to me)... All I know is that have I leaked bloody mess all over half a dozen or so bra's in the last 8 weeks, I sleep 12 hours a night plus 3-4 hours during the day and still feel knackered, my right shoulder aches like I have been throwing a bowling ball overarm for hours non-stop, my right boob is not fitting the bra like the left one...and I have no nipple anymore, its merged with the areola completely and is like a thick, flat pancake that is insanely tingly and itchy...the symptoms are similar to that experienced before but alot stronger. Apparently the appointment can take upto 6 hours...they try to get all testing done and results delivered whilst I am captive there...oh joy.... The science boffins can do lots of things, but we still cannot get a new body on prescription (yet)
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 03:34PM pagodaswan wrote: Thanks Jo... I have never been sure why "boobs" are so important...OK so they are handy for breastfeeding, but apart from that?? I know that I wouldn't miss mine...and I also see no point in having them reconstructed should they be evicted due to their bad behaviour.  The left one is already messed up since it only has half a nipple after previous duct removals...if I could have my way tomorrow it would be a case of "take them off...now, please" but I bet I would have a fight on my hands, but to me, they have become a liability and a worry that I do not want or need...
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 05:01PM - edited Aug 13, 2012 05:02PM by pagodaswan Jo.....on the previous 4 occasions it was referral from GP to general surgeon and then to theater within a couple of days and ducts removed...the last time it was ducts and two lymph nodes removed from my side on right side, where the problem has recurred again for 3rd time...left side twice.. During those times, I had one mammogram and no biopsies taken at all. From the letter I have, along with the questionaire, it has physical examination, then a choice (theirs, not mine) of ultrasound and/or mammogram and depending on results of that, either a core or fine needle biopsy.  Then discussion in the room with surgeon to decide the next step (if any). In the period tween the original problems and since, I have had no rechecking done...and tbh I didn't ask about it as I misguidedly thought that it wouldn't happen again.
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 04:11PM pagodaswan wrote: If I am in a mood and someone says something sarcastic like "oooh must be time of the month"...I usually snap back "if it is, then I am suing the bloody surgeon!"
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 05:03PM pagodaswan wrote: Thanks carpediem :) Due to having a stroke, I am not allowed HRT...thanks to COPD I can't have ibuprofen...I'm allergic to plasters and pennicillin.... I do so wish that the boffins would just hurry up and organise new bodies on presription...it would make life so much easier and less stressful...it would have to be female boffins though cos the blokes would make new female bodies all "tits & arse" and we would likely be back at square one again LOL
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2012 02:47PM pagodaswan wrote: Ello peeps Just thought I would update things since its been a while since my last post. Heard absolutely nothing whatsoever from the breast surgeon, I still have bloody discharge and the deep achey pain in my right armpit/arm/back is gradually getting worse, to the extent that using my right arm for more than 5-10 minutes at a time is nigh on impossible.  The aereola and nipple are still thickened and inverted...so apart from gradually getting more visible, I am still waiting for something to be done. I am seeing the GP on Friday morning to try and chivvy things along but at this stage, I am not hopeful to be honest. Hope everyone here is doing as well as possible, take care, chin up and keep fighting!
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 02:35PM pagodaswan wrote: Thanks for that toomuch... To be brutally honest, I have seriously considered asking for bilateral mastectomies just to get it over with regardless as to the cause this time around. I live alone, I have no surviving family/significant other....and I am just so tired of all this. I had a stroke in 2007, I have COPD and arthritis...I know this probably sounds daft but the boobs are not an essential part of me and they drive me to distraction with this repeating issue...I cannot help but wonder if OK I have done this 4 times already, one of these days it WILL be malignant and that my "luck" will have run out. Get rid of the boobs and I might actually be able to get on with life...if only it was so simple LOL
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2012 01:57PM pagodaswan wrote: One thing about the mammogram images...she showed them to me... I could tell the outlines of each boob, but internally they were totally opaque/white...couldn't see a thing (or at least I couldn't).  So I asked how she could be certain that it was just "in distress"...and she turned to me and said " well the ducts, what is left of them, appear to be inflamed and swollen but I cannot see why they are so " She just said that the boobs are really too dense to tell what was happening and that I just have to report any further changes to my GP whilst they have a case meeting next week and decide my future treatment. I asked if I would be able to speak for myself at the case meeting and it was a case of "we never allow patients into the discussion as it gets too emotionally charged to make a clear decision for us".. Unfortunately the first available appointment with my GP is a week tomorrow (Aug 22)...so just going to have to pad out the bra to soak up the bloody mess, and wait patiently....something I rarely do willingly :(
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 01:23PM pagodaswan wrote:

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 03:35PM pagodaswan wrote: Thanks Nikki :) I am at the stage where I just want to be taken seriously...Under my purple dyed hair I am a natural blonde, I was never taken seriously hence why I dyed it years ago....these people must have x-ray vision, cos they sure as hell aren't taking me seriously at all...YET.. Camille...love it...restaurant & playground closed....yeah LOL  Great way to put it :)
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2012 12:26PM pagodaswan wrote: Ello Caryn... Yep, I made a double length appointmentwith my GP for next week, it was the earliest available for her specifically, so will talk it through with her and see if she will push them to a decision. I just want it over with...the boobs are attached to me, but I am certainly not attached to them...just have to convince everyone that I mean that.
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 11:21AM pagodaswan wrote: OK...so now this is becoming really weird (and a bit worrying too). I have my appointment this Wednesday with my GP to see if she can give the hospital a push...since last week I was given the brush off (and screening mammograms rather tha diagnostic ones)... 10 minutes ago, my phone rings...its the breast clinic, the head of department (clinical director/chief consultant) wants to see me. It was a case of "We need to see you and the next available appointment is this Thursday morning August 24, is that convenient?" I have accepted the appointment....but am now getting a bit worried since it is a complete about turn from last week.
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 12:57PM pagodaswan wrote: Aye...you could be right, Jo.... Quite a turnaround though...and seeing the "top" consultant in the department too... You cannot help but wonder somethimes...
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 05:40PM pagodaswan wrote: Nikki...I was told by my respiratory consultant that COPD patients should not take ibuprofen as it is an irritant apparently... It was a bit of a bummer really since the stroke, I get severe migraines and guess what helped more than anything else...?  yep...ibuprofen  (sods law strikes again)... Camille...if you don't laugh, you cry...and if you cry too much, you end up with a permanent wet t-shirt competition (not to mention that red eyes are just not a good look with the make-up and hair that you just spent an hour geting perfect ;) ) I do take an aspirin every day...along with a statin...thins the blood, helps prevent strokes...but makes bigger messes on the bloody bra (sort of pun intended there)... Never mind bodies being all tits and arse...mine seems to be going tits up...and that would be funny had it not been for the serious misbehaviour of tits in general....remind me...just WHY do we have tits again?
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 02:15PM pagodaswan wrote: Thanks Celine.. Its the "not again" combined with the "not knowing" that makes me nervous....this time around its at a proper breast clinic, las time it was in a different part of the UK and just a "normal" general surgeon. I have come to the conclusion that the human body is a diabolical design, hopeless reliability and a complete nightmare to maintain...
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 04:19PM pagodaswan wrote: Thanks caryn... I wonder what will be said tomorrow if after all the tests and they say another duct excavation is required, I turn round and say please take both boobs right off and lets be done with it?  Afterall, it will be the 5th time down this road...how many more times am I going to have to deal with it before it turns into something nasty and end up taking them off anyway? I was never checked after the last 4 occasions, so I honestly do not feel this time around will be any different...so do I have to live with that fear of the tingling and blood in my bra again? I don't want to...I am 48...the usefullness of my boobs has long passed...they are ornaments that have outlived their welcome...trouble is, how do I get that across to this new surgeon person?
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 05:09PM pagodaswan wrote: Another thing that concerns me is that when I had a second head MRI after the stroke (due to severe ongoing migraine like headaches), the radiologist noted the stroke damage plus a 3mm mass in the right rear ventricle of my brain.  The neuro has dismissed it as probably genetic or from birth defect. But the human worry wort syndrome that we all have, that is inside me right now is trying very hard to connect that pea sized mass with what has happened in the right boob...most likely no connection whatsoever, but when this happens again for the fifth time...well....I can't help but make 2+2=5...no matter how ridiculous it is...
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 05:21PM pagodaswan wrote: Well...its gone 10pm, so I am off to try and get some sleep before tomorrow's fun and games....thanks for all the support, will report back sometime tomorrow...night night :)
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2012 05:25PM pagodaswan wrote: Ello Jo... I asked about an MRI and was told "no point", so didn't take it any further.  I am going to ask my GP about genetic testing though...aswell as for her to put pressure onto the panel and maybe refer me herself to the oncology-psychologist for counselling. Over the last week or so I have "borrowed" a neighbours access to various sites such as Ancestry.com etc and tried to find family members...cousins mainly since I am the last in my close family bloodline. Had one hell of a shock this morning before going to the appointment so mentioned the information to the consultant, but to no real avail..  On my mother's side of the family, both her sisters died of "lady cancer" which I assumed to be either breast and/or ovarian cancer in the 1960's...both under 50 years old. On my dad's side of the family, his younger sister and mother died of cancer...not known as to which...in the 1970's and 1980's respectively.,,,both before the age of 60. The biggest shock was my older sister, she died in 1994 through suicide.  I did not know why or anything at the time and I never asked.  Through searches I managed to findher now remarried ex husband and he told me what happened.  She had found a lump in her breast at 44 years old, kept quiet about it cos she was scared, then got really sick and was taken to hospital where they found cancer all over her body...she couldn't cope, fell into a deep depression and overdosed on painkiller. I knew something about my aunt's on my mothers side but nothing about the deaths on my dad's side nor the true reason for my sister killing herself til today. I will be filling my GP in on all the new information next week and just hope that she will push for testing and for a quick resolution to the surgery request too.
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 02:34PM pagodaswan wrote: Thank you Camille :) It's kinda funny...one of the questions asked by the breast cancer care nurse last week tickled me... "What about when/if you meet a nice guy...are you sure that you want your breasts removed?" My reply was simple...."I am a person, not a pair of boobs on legs...if that person cannot get around the fact that I don't have any, then he is too shallow for my requirements...I would rather stay single than have someone like that in my life"
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2012 12:09PM pagodaswan wrote: So I am back from the appointment....not happy but have to follow procedure... I had mammograms on both boobs, plus ultrasound on the misbehaving boob. The results were that both boobs are very dense so difficult to say without any certainty as to what the problem(s) are.  The consultant breast surgeon was called in during the ultrasound and confirmed that the ducts that are left from previous surgeries are showing "signs of distress" but she was unable to diagnose the type of "distress". Suggested I wait and see for 3-4 months to see if it settled down on its own...I said no way and burst into tears. Was ushered into another consulting room with a breast care nurse and we discussed options, I said that with the history - now 5 flare ups + family history - I couldn't face having to wait and see and just pretend the problems would go away. I told her that I wanted bilateral mastectomy...afterall, I have enough health issues on my plate, I do not need another one hanging round my neck on a "wait and see" basis. She agreed with me and said she had seen many women in my position who were adamant that enough was enough.  However, procedures are there to be followed, so the breast care nurse was going to discuss it with the consultant and then it would go the panel next week.  If the panel decide that I have good reason for bilateral mastectomy, I will be referred to an oncology-psychologist for councelling and if they accept that I mean what I say, then I will go onto the waiting list for surgery. I asked if there was a short cut, she said unlikely although I could try circumventing it by seeing my GP and having her refer me to the oncology-psychologist rather than waiting for a decision by the panel. Apparently the panel consists of breast care nurses, radiologists & breast surgeons.  She also told me that one surgeon was on maternity leave and the other on long term sick leave.... Upshot of it is that I might get turned down for bilateral mastectomy or if I get approval by the panel and the psychologist approve then it could be done early next year. In the meantime I have to watch for further deterioration or symptoms and go see the GP if that happens. I feel like I wasted 6 hours of my day tbh....
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2012 07:57AM pagodaswan wrote: So...just got home from the latest appointment, this time with the breast surgeon/consultant. He is referring me to the genticist and the oncology-psychologist with a view to carrying out a preventative bilateral mastectomy. He accepted that my family history and current/previous history of breast symptoms was grounds to go ahead, but there are set procedures to follow first, which is fine.  I told him that I would not change my mind and he accepted that fully but reiterated that he has to go through the set route. Once the referrals have been completed, he will arrange to see me again to discuss how to proceed and when. So although it will be a bit of a long winded process, at least now I can hope that my wishes will be carried out as I want them to be...something that after last week's appointment I really did not feel would happen since they were rushed and quite abrupt with me.  The surgeon is the lead consultant in the breast clinic and he seemed genuinely caring and concerned about my thoughts and feelings...so I am quietly hopeful.
Posts.Title: Going down the same road again for 5th time and nervous pagodaswan pagodaswan
